source.description: Place 5-10 sections of tissue in an Eppendorf tube and keep on ice.

Add
lysis buffer to tubes and vortex for 30-60 seconds.
Place tubes in dry ice for

Defrost tubes on wet ice for
and then vortex briefly.
Add ice to water in the sonicator to make an icy slurry.

Sonicate samples in ice bath for
and vortex.

Spin tubes in microcentrifuge for
at 14000rpm.
Pipet supernatant into new labeled Eppendorf tube. Discard pelleted tissue.

Add
of protein sample to 1.2mL square Abgene plate.

Add lysis buffer to the sample to equal
.

Add
ice cold 75:25 acetone:methanol to the sample.

Seal plate with sealing mat and agitate gently by hand. Incubate for
at
. Alternatively, incubate overnight at
. Place plate rotor in cold centrifuge at
.

Remove plate from freezer and centrifuge samples for
at 4000 RPM. When removing from centrifuge, place on ice or cold block to prevent pellet from dislodging.

Add
of ice cold acetone to all samples and spin for
at 4000 RPM.

Remove and discard supernatent. Briefly allow residual acetone to evaporate from the plate at room temperature. The drying should only be as long as it takes to get TFE and Tris ready to add. Do not over-dry the pellet, or it may not dissolve properly.

Prepare (items) for use on Bravo:
1. Prepare 100nM TCEP (Make the following for each column used on Bravo)
Add
of 0.5M TCEP +
of Rapid Trypsin Digestion Buffer
Add
to each well in a Greiner clear U bottom plate
2. Prepare 200mM IAA (Make the following for each column used on Bravo)
Dilute 1 vial of pre-weighed IAA with
of Rapid Trypsin Digestion Buffer
Add
of 0.5M IAA +
of Rapid Trypsin Digestion Buffer
Add
to each well in a Greiner clear U bottom plate
3. Add
of Rapid Trypsin Digestion Buffer to each well in a 1.2mL Abgene plate.

Resuspend the 100ug pellet in
of neat TFE and
of 100mM Tris (pH 8.0). Vortex gently or use T-shake on Bravo at max speed for
.

Set up automation with Bravo In-Solution Digestion: Single Plate v1.0:
1. Browse for a Method:
VWorks Workspace→Methods→AM In Solution Digestion Single Plate v1.0→DARPA in Solution Digestion
(or most current digestion method)
2. Load Values
3. Place plates/reservoirs with lids on appropriate spots on robot deck.

Reduce with
of 100mM TCEP at room temperature for
. Bravo will pause after addition. Place IAA plate on Bravo deck and restart.

Akylate with
of 200mM IAA in the dark at room temperature for
(place in drawer below Bravo). Bravo will pause after addition.

Add
of Rapid Trypsin Digestion Buffer to sample with Bravo.

While Bravo is adding diluent, prepare Promega Rapid Trypsin by adding
of Promega Resuspension Buffer to 1 bottle of rapid trypsin.

Add
prepared 1ug/ul Rapid Trypsin manually to each well (1:25 enzyme:protein).
Replace sealing mat or seal plate with PlateLoc and gently shake.

Incubate plate at
for
.

Remove plate from incubator and pulse in centrifuge for
to move any condensation back into the wells.

Add
60% Formic Acid manually to each well.

Seal plate with sealing mat or aluminum seal using PlateLoc and either prepare for desalting or place plate in
for future use.

Prepare items for use on Bravo and place on plate deck.
* Columns filled in 12 well reservoir plates will correspond to sample columns filled in PCR plate:
Prepare Equilibration plate by adding
Equilibration buffer to wells
Prepare Priming and Syringe plate by adding
Priming and Syringe wash buffer to wells.
Prepare Elution plate by adding
Elution buffer to each column.
  1. Make sure that water wash bottles are full to the top.
  2. Place C18 cartridges on tip deck corresponding to number of samples.
Add
of sample to Eppendorf PCR plate (this includes 10 uL overage).
Centrifuge plate at 4000g for
to pellet any debris and remove bubbles.

. Continue checking until samples are completely dried.

source.title: Preparing Samples for Instrument - Reconstitute Dried Sample

source.description: Label Eppendorf tubes and place vial inserts into each one.

source.title: Preparing Samples for Instrument - Reconstitute Dried Sample

source.description: Label LC autosampler vials and set aside.

source.title: Preparing Samples for Instrument - Reconstitute Dried Sample

source.description:
Add
of 0.1% Formic Acid to each well, pipetting up and down 10x. This will make a 1ug/uL solution for analysis.

source.title: Preparing Samples for Instrument - Reconstitute Dried Sample

source.description: Pipette sample into respective vial insert/tube.

source.title: Preparing Samples for Instrument - Reconstitute Dried Sample

source.description: Briefly spin tube to remove any air bubbles in insert.

source.title: Preparing Samples for Instrument - Reconstitute Dried Sample

source.description: Use forceps to move into labeled LC vial and cap.

source.title: Preparing Samples for Instrument - Reconstitute Dried Sample

source.description:
Store in
freezer until ready for instrument.
Carefully remove and discard supernatent.

description:
Scope:
To describe the procedure for the lysis, reduction/alkylation, trypsin digestion, and clean-up of tissue. Lysis will cover the lysing of tissue and protein concentration. Acetone precipitation will cover the precipitation of proteins. Digestion will cover the process for digesting 100 µg of protein using the Agilent AssayMap Bravo Robot and Promega Rapid Trypsin/LysC. The clean-up of the cells will cover the desalting process on the Agilent AssayMap Bravo and the subsequent preparation of the samples for LC/MS peptide analysis.
Expected Outcome/Data:
Cell samples lysed, digested, and desalted for analysis on MS instrument. Samples to be analyzed within one or two days of desalting.
